brief_summary.textblock:
We are investigating the role of an enzyme (NQO1) in protection against the bone marrow
      toxicity of the occupational and environmental toxicant benzene. All of the proposed studies
      involve use of human bone marrow cells in-vitro to define mechanisms of NQO1-mediated
      protection. Cells are obtained from healthy volunteers and protocols have undergone IRB
      review and approval.

criteria.textblock:
Healthy adult volunteers with blood counts in normal ranges and without evidence of
        hepatitis or HIV infection.

facility.name: University of Colorado Health Sciences Center

clinical_study.official_title: NQO1 in Protection Against Benzene Toxicity

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.source: National Institute of Environmental Health Sciences (NIEHS)

clinical_study.study_design: Primary Purpose: Screening, Time Perspective: Prospective
